attributes.action: end the softly, softly approach by the Government and the laws of this country when road death and serious injuries are committed on our roads and these offenders to be held accountable for their actions.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We therefore are asking the Government for a major reform of the current laws which also include the new law of “Death by Careless Driving” which is to be introduced later this year which still does not go anywhere near enough in respect of justice, and the Government to drop its outdated view on this serious escalating matter where road deaths and serious injuries occur through bad driving. Offenders should be tried in a Crown Court with judge and jury and where road death has occurred we feel the death of a loved one should be dealt with in the same way as a death by shooting or a knife and therefore should carry the same sentencing guidelines.
